section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of necessary hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance at its convenience, without prior notice.
explanation: This section presents a contradiction. It initially states that i-on will maintain the Hosted Site continuously, 24/7, but then immediately introduces an exception for maintenance. The phrase "without prior notice" directly contradicts the expectation of continuous operation because the customer has no way of knowing when the site will be down for maintenance. It creates ambiguity around the guaranteed uptime and service level.

section: Under this Agreement, i-on will provide the following limited services for the Hosted Site: 1. connectivity to the Internet via a T1 (that may be shared by other Web sites) to a leading Internet backbone access provider such as UUNET, and will not be responsible for maintaining such connectivity with the phone company and the Internet backbone access provider;
explanation: This section contains an ambiguity. While i-on provides connectivity to the internet, it is unclear whether they are responsible for resolving connectivity issues with the Internet backbone access provider. They provide the service but disclaim responsibility for maintaining it. It is unclear whose responsibility it is to resolve the connectivity issues.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees within 30 days of receiving the invoice. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner may result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: This section presents a potential issue. While it specifies that fees are due within 30 days of receiving the invoice, it doesn't define the exact consequences of late payment. It says interruption or discontinuation of services *may* result. It does not specify the grace period before interruption of services will occur, or at what point the services will be discontinued. This leaves the customer in a state of uncertainty and does not provide legal clarity.
